abstract: Pres Obama changes policy regarding Americans kidnapped abroad, signing presidential directive and executive order declaring for first time that government, families or other entities can negotiate with hostage takers toward benefit of getting them returned; order, which allows other concessions in response to criticism by families of American hostages, stops short of reversing long-standing edict against paying ransoms to terrorist groups.
lead_paragraph: The president said the United States’ policy to not pay ransoms did not mean that officials could not communicate with abductors or help in other ways to free American hostages.

headline.main: In Hostage-Terrorist Policy Shift, Obama Admits Failures
headline.print_headline: In Hostage Policy Shift, Obama Admits Failures
